author: Pascal
title: Celebrities Onboarding

assessments.note:
Based on the idea of deep research and the academic approach used on Cardano development, I think that the association of the Cardano / Catalyst brand with marketing campaigns for celebrities to create token offerings can have a negative impact, since there are countless cases of celebrities promoting scams.

I can see some positive examples of this concept in the area of NFTs, but it doesn't seem to be the idea described in this challenge setting proposal.

There's a fine line whether this is a solution or a challenge. As mentioned in the comments there is a bit of overlap with this idea: https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Lobbying-team/342043-48088

This, however, suggests that celebrities should launch their own tokens on Cardano. Why?

Are you aiming for something like this: https://rally.io/

While I agree with the onboarding of celebrities for publicity, it does raise a few questions:

Why would celebrities need other resources than other folk? Wouldn't it be better to create a second proposal, offering information to the general public and then collaborate with that project? This could take a bit longer, but would be a lot more durable and it would greatly increase the impact.

Celebrities certainly are a way of marketing Cardano mission in regards of onboarding the mainstream populace, but this is a natural flow in effect as the technology becomes more pervasive and usable on a day to day basis. There are more pressing institutional bridges that are more important than popularity at this stage. But certainly a good idea to explore as the project advances further with its developmental opportunities after smart contracts are launched.

Always good to get additional publicity, but at what cost? There are lots of pump and dump from celebs in the crypto space as is, this may end up having a negative effect if done wrong. Personally, I don't think its critical

Maybe I see this too 'down to earth', but we are still building the foundations and the first floors of a solid skyscraper. Having celebrities promoting the penthouses too early can easily go wrong (we can easily become part of this awful-tasting crypto-scam-soup). Also Charles is saying: 'Rogan after Goguen'.
This type of challenge is probably best done as an objective of a DApp project that is relevant to the industry/problem it is addressing but not as something we should consider at a global level.
do we really need to pay celebrities , we cardano should be attracive by itself

Absolutely not, i do agree that celebrities have an important power, but i do think that the whole cardano's mission is very far from the celebs ... Specially since the whole thing is about empowering low-income country and ppl. They just dont relate to celebrities...

The idea of promoting Cardano to celebrities as a solution for token offers is feasible, we already have native assets in the blockchain and soon it will be possible to create smart contracts in mainnet, so from a technical point of view there is viability.

I am not sure that tools and documents are the most effective way to attract celebrities, because to make token offerings or NFTs there are already tools developed and under development and there is no indication that additional tools are needed. Regarding documents, I think the idea needs to be more detailed, there is no clear and significant difference that shows that celebrities need additional documentation in relation to ordinary users.

I can understand that a marketing campaign can be effective in this case, but not tools and documentation. I recommend that the proposer explain this approach in more details.
It's hard to see how the wider community can make this happen.
You will need people to reach out to these celebrities and persuade them. How are you going to establish such a network?
The proposal and challenge appears feasible but more information is required to assess the focus and the interest in carrying that path this early into the project's prospects.

Marketing to celebs is possible because of social network platforms. This part is straight forward enough. I dont think the amount of money is really necessary, that amount and it could market to a general audience with more success in my opinion. One thing Im not understanding is the celeb token, its not clear to me why this is needed. More detail would be appreciated.

I think that the community would definitely be able to address this challenge. This is more about professional 'reputation management'. I think that it is much better to show tangible and beneficial real-world applications first and refrain from gossiping about rankings and getting rich and richer (what celebrity marketing concepts can easily turn out to become - not saying that you want this with your proposal).
with the community growing help to market a DApp help & contact will always be available

The metrics described are subjective, how do you define who a celebrity is? Number of transactions with NFTs can be inflated with wash trading. Number of native assets created is not an efficient indicator, as it is very easy to create native tokens on Cardano and these numbers alone can be insignificant. I recommend including more robust metrics.
Not sure I understand the proposed metrics.

I like that you have provided a somewhat rudimentary roadmap. You could improve it by adding milestones by placing amounts on the number of adoptions. Why does this need 100000 USD? What are you going to use the fund on exactly?

The metrics appear slightly basic and questions such as what are they interested in doing with Cardano? why would we seek to monitor personal transactions of members of the community as where as why are ethical question the proposer needs to perhaps expand on.

Metrics are there which is great but they are overly simplistic in my opinion. Not all celebs are equal so counting a number of them doesn't seem so great as you could count less known ones as well. As mentioned the celeb tokens don't appear necessary but I may be missing something so additional thoughts would be nice on how that would be used.

It is for sure possible to define solid KPI behind such a Challenge Setting. This is for sure well-measurable, but again: I do not see this as a priority at this stage of the Cardano/Catalyst journey.
i don't see how the metrics will help at a global level.
most of them will get the money speak about cardano and then forget us for next check

you seem to be wanting to make the stock go up, but not pushing the mission. Sadly i dont see how this proposal can get a good note. Maybe your idea is worth something but you need to explain way more and target specific celebrities, give a better detailed plan, and so on.

importance:
1. More native celeb assets on Cardano -> faster diffusion of innovation -> more success stories -> repeat
2. +assets -> +trans. -> +ADA
success: A high user experience in a targeted set of tools and documents motivates Celebs to create and manage their own tokens on Cardano.
